nodes.text: The Zardossa airspeeder was a model of airspeeder associated with the moon Zardossa Stix. In 19 BBY, while chasing after Moregi on the moon Pantora, the bounty hunter Asajj Ventress hijacked a Zardossa airspeeder from a Rodian driver and used it to continue her pursuit of the Volpai.

The Zardossa airspeeder was made for "The Disappeared, Part II," the ninth episode of the animated television series Star Wars: The Clone Wars' sixth season, The Lost Missions, released on March 7, 2014. While concept art of the speeder drawn by Hyunwoo Lim was included in the episode's concept art gallery on StarWars.com, where it is identified as the "Zardossa airspeeder," the vehicle does not appear in "The Disappeared, Part II" itself. The Zardossa airspeeder would have later appeared in an arc of the series featuring Asajj Ventress and Quinlan Vos, however The Clone Wars was canceled prior to this story's completion and it was instead adapted by Christie Golden as the 2015 novel Dark Disciple. In the novel, the vehicle is referred to simply as a "single-seat speeder."
